title: How to Install Kodi on an Amazon Fire Stick

steps.title: Turn on your Fire TV.
steps.content: Turn on your Fire TV. This should load the Amazon Fire TV home screen.

steps.title: Scroll over to Settings and select it.
steps.content: Scroll over to Settings and select it. It's five tabs to the right from the home screen. This will open the Settings menu.

steps.title: Scroll over to Applications and select it.
steps.content: Scroll over to Applications and select it. This will open the Applications menu.

steps.title: Select Collect App Usage Data.
steps.content: Select Collect App Usage Data . It's the top option in the Applications menu. A pop-up window will appear.

steps.title: Select Turn Off when prompted.
steps.content: Select Turn Off when prompted.

steps.title: Return to the Settings menu.
steps.content: Return to the Settings menu. Press the "Back" button to do so.

steps.title: Scroll over to Device and select it.
steps.content: Scroll over to Device and select it. The Device menu will open.

steps.title: Scroll down to Developer options and select it.
steps.content: Scroll down to Developer options and select it. It's near the top of the Device menu.

steps.title: Select ADB debugging.
steps.content: Select ADB debugging . This will turn it on. If you see ON below this option, ADB debugging is already on.

steps.title: Scroll down and select Apps from Unknown Sources.
steps.content: Scroll down and select Apps from Unknown Sources . Doing so will prompt a pop-up window. If you see ON below Apps from Unknown Sources , you don't need to turn it on.

steps.title: Select Turn On.
steps.content: Select Turn On . This allows you to install non-Play Store apps, including Kodi.

steps.title: Return to the Amazon home screen.
steps.content: Return to the Amazon home screen. Press the "Back" button until you reach the home screen, or press the "Home" button if available.

steps.title: Open Search.
steps.content: Open Search. Select the "Search" tab, which resembles a magnifying glass in the upper-left corner of the screen. A text box will appear.

steps.title: Type downloader into Search.
steps.content: Type downloader into Search. As you type, you'll see a progressively shorter list of app suggestions below the on-screen keyboard.

steps.title: Select Downloader.
steps.content: Select Downloader . It should be the only app suggestion below the keyboard. Doing so searches the app store for the Downloader app.

steps.title: Select the Downloader app.
steps.content: Select the Downloader app. This is an orange box with the word "Downloader" and a giant arrow on it. Selecting this app will open its app page.

steps.title: Select Get it or Download.
steps.content: Select Get it or Download . It's on the left side of the screen, just below the Downloader app description. This will begin downloading the Downloader app onto your Fire TV.

steps.title: Select Open.
steps.content: Select Open . Once the Downloader app finishes downloading, this option will appear; select it to open the Downloader app, from which point you can download the Kodi app.

steps.title: Select OK if prompted.
steps.content: Select OK if prompted. This will close the new features announcement.

steps.title: Select the URL box.
steps.content: Select the URL box. Your cursor will automatically appear, so just press your remote's middle button to open the on-screen keyboard.

steps.title: Enter Kodi's download address.
steps.content: Enter Kodi's download address. Type kodi.tv into the URL box, then select Go . This will take you to Kodi's webpage.

steps.title: Select OK when prompted.
steps.content: Select OK when prompted. You can now interact with the webpage.

steps.title: Scroll down to the Android icon and select it.
steps.content: Scroll down to the Android icon and select it. It resembles the Android figure.

steps.title: Scroll down and select Android.
steps.content: Scroll down and select Android . Again, this is the Android figure, though it's green this time. The Kodi for Android download page will open.

steps.title: Scroll down and select ARMV7A (32BIT).
steps.content: Scroll down and select ARMV7A (32BIT) . It's below the "Kodi v17.4 'Krypton'" heading. Kodi will begin downloading onto your Fire Stick. If you have the larger Amazon Fire TV box (rather than the Fire Stick), you'll select the 64BIT version.

steps.title: Select INSTALL.
steps.content: Select INSTALL . It's in the bottom-right corner of the screen. This will begin installing Kodi. The entire installation process should only take a few seconds, after which point you can open Kodi by selecting OPEN at the bottom of the screen.
